originalText.text: Very convenient.  I was in the neighborhood for training.  You can tell the pizza was made by someone with experience. I'm particular.  For me, the pizza could have more crisp to the crust, though.  Otherwise, it was very good and hit the spot.  I bought 2 slices.

originalText.text:
SCAMMERS!!!

Be careful with this scam store. They sell non-working stuff to customers, then they force you to take something else for exchange, because there is no money back.

SCAMMERS!!!

SCAMMERS!!!

SCAMMERS!!!

originalText.text: If I could I would give zero stars. I brought several things that didn’t work and would want to give me a refund only store credit. Why would I want to continue to purchase from a store that doesn’t sell working items? At the time they didn’t have store hours posted. Glad they have it now. Not a neighborhood friendly store. Save yourself your time and money and shop somewhere else.

originalText.text:
Do not spend any money in this place. They are selling items that don’t work to customers who just want to honestly spend money on their quality of life.
I went into this store today to purchase a window fan which ended up costing $46+ and went straight home and plugged it in. The fans propellers were moving but now wind was being created. So I went back to the store and told the store clerk that I had just purchased the item and just wanted my money back to find out that they do not do cash refunds. Store credit only which is illegal, unconstitutional and goes against the very reason the Better Business Bureau even exists.
Don’t waste your money here. This is not a community store or even a convenience store because nothing was convenient about this shopping experience at all and I will be filing a complaint against this store with the Better Business Bureau.

originalText.text: The staff is but very friendly or helpful, in fact they act as if everyone is a thief.
